Description: Rounded axe-blade: with a single perforation. The cutting edge has been worked from both faces of the blade. The butt is slightly concave and the flat surfaces of the blade are partially corroded. The cutting edge has been hammered from both faces of the tool, and is slightly chipped.
Curator's comments: The date of acquisition suggests that this axe may have come from the Early Dynastic royal tombs at Abydos, where many similar axes were found. See E. Amélineau, ‘Les Nouvelles Fouilles d’Abydos’ II (1896-7), 256-8, 262, 264-5 and pl.XVIII, 3-5.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (8)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
